Event.name: Import_export_scenario
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> moves <fen>Goods</fen> (or some other useful item) from an <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, across a boundary or border to a different area, the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. The <fen>Path</fen> along which the <fen>Goods</fen> pass may also be indicated. Depending on the lexical unit, the <fen>Agent</fen> 's point of view may be centered on the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> at the beginning of the process (e.g. <ment>export</ment>) or on the <fen>Importing_area</fen> and the end of the process (e.g. <ment>import</ment>) or on the <fen>Path</fen> (e.g. <ment>transship</ment>). In some sentences, a constituent which encodes the <fen>Agent</fen> FE also encodes information about the <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
<ex>Cooperating was an old term used by the Customs service to describe the illegal traffic of contraband<fex name="Goods"></fex>sold and <t>transhipped</t> <fex name="Exporting_area">from larger vessels</fex> <fex name="Importing_area">into small local boats</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition: <def-root>An mobile entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that holds the <fen>Goods</fen> and moves them along from the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> to the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root>The items of value whose location is changing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in performing the action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state of a participant during the action </def-root>

Arg.name: Importing_area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> identifies the location of the <fen>Goods</fen> during transit, i.e. after leaving the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> and before reaching the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Exporting_area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the action.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Descriptor
Arg.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element is used for a characteristic or description of the <fen>Goods</fen>. Note that <fen>Descriptor</fen> is not an FE of the same character as other FEs. Specifically, rather than filling a slot, it identifies a modifier of its head noun. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: transship.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: transfer (cargo) from one ship or other form of transport to another.

lexUnit.name: exporter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or (metonymically) a place that moves goods to another region.

lexUnit.name: importer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or (metonymically) a place that moves goods into a region.

lexUnit.name: trans-shipping.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of transferring cargo to move it towards its ultimate destination.
